intro: Sideroxylon chrysophylloides, commonly known as the golden-leafed ironwood, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a striking golden-yellow color when fully mature. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing a single seed.
